bibl.title: Letter from Walter D. McCaw to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 15, 1925

div1.p: McCaw sends Kean a critique of Mark Sullivan's article on Gorgas, and tells Kean that he believes Sullivan wants to present a truthful account of Gorgas' yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from Walter D. McCaw to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 15, 1925
div1.p:
The Assistant or Amanuensis
or “sumpin” of Mr Sullivan
came in this morning, & I gave
him this, just as I dictated it
and un-corrected, I dont think
much of the verbiage or even
the grammar, but it will give
Mr Sullivan I hope some valuable
hints. By the way I think
he and his young man
are entirely “on” & want only
the real truth. Its not like a
magazine article, but a chapter in a 4 vol
History of recent years
